OWN FUNDS
footnote: For the purposes of the EBAs Transparency exercise, the total risk exposure amount fully loaded is computed as difference between phased total risk exposure amount (REA) and transitional provisions which affect the total REA, as both reported  to the EBA with templates C 02.00 (item B) and C 05.01 (item B.1) of Annex I the ITS on Supervisory Reporting. For KBC the difference between phased and fully loaded REAs consists of a sovereign carve-out (i.e. the phased interdiction, imposed by National Bank of Belgium (NBB), to apply a zero weighting for sovereign exposure under the permanent partial use of the standardised approach) and differences on DTA's that rely on future profitability and arise from temporary differences. The carve-out on sovereigns, which is the bulk of the amount, are not included by KBC in the amount of Transitional provisions in C05.01 Therefore, the formula = D.1 / (B  B.1) underestimates KBCs real figures .

footnote: Within the scope of the EBA Transparency Exercise 2017, data on the highest consolidation level of the financial holding company, HSH Beteiligungs Management GmbH, is published for the first time. However, the bank's investor and financial reporting focuses mainly on the sub-consolidated group level of HSH Nordbank AG and is based on the IFRS financial statements of the latter. For this reason, on its own investor relations website the institution will publish both the EBA Transparency Exercise 2017 data at the highest consolidation level for the financial holding HSH Beteiligungs Management GmbH, and the sub-consolidated group level data of HSH Nordbank AG. The data referring to the sub-consolidated group level of HSH Nordbank AG is published on the institutions own responsibility; hence, the relevant templates have not been reviewed by the supervisory authorities.

footnote: "Fully loaded CET1 capital does not include preference shares, according to the applicable regulatory framework.
